triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: Statistical model checking is an extension of model checking that uses statistical methods to estimate probabilities.

triples.name: Probability
triples.relevance: The paper estimates probabilities and uses them as the primary quantity of interest in probabilistic systems.

triples.name: Expected value
triples.relevance: Expected rewards are one of the main quantities the paper aims to estimate using sound statistical methods.

triples.name: Monte Carlo method
triples.relevance: Random simulations used in statistical model checking are based on Monte Carlo sampling techniques.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: Reachability rewards are a specific type of reward analyzed in the paper for which bounds are proven.

triples.name: Dvoretzky–Kiefer–Wolfowitz inequality
triples.relevance: The paper recommends this inequality as a new method for statistical model checking that had not been previously used in SMC.

triples.name: Probably approximately correct learning
triples.relevance: The paper introduces limit-PAC procedures that formalize the concept of probably approximately correct guarantees for practical statistical model checking.
